metadata.name: get_url2_swf_4
metadata.description: Tests GET_URL2 opcode (0x9A) - Stack-based URL loading with HTTP method support. Comprehensive test coverage including all flag combinations, edge cases (empty strings, concatenated URLs), and multiple HTTP methods (GET/POST) for both browser windows and sprite targets. In NO_GRAPHICS mode, verifies correct stack operations, flag parsing, and operation logging.
missing_features: Actual HTTP client functionality (requires libcurl or similar HTTP library)
Variable encoding to x-www-form-urlencoded format (requires variable enumeration)
HTTP response parsing (requires HTTP client and response parser)
Setting variables in target scope from response (requires full variable/scope management)
SWF file downloading and loading (requires HTTP client and SWF parser/loader)
MovieClip/sprite path resolution and management (requires full sprite hierarchy)
Browser window integration (requires platform-specific OS APIs)
Cross-domain security policy enforcement (requires security sandbox infrastructure)

implementation_notes.stack_operations: Correctly pops URL and target from stack
implementation_notes.flag_parsing: All flags correctly parsed: SendVarsMethod (bits 7-6), LoadTargetFlag (bit 1), LoadVariablesFlag (bit 0)
implementation_notes.string_handling: Handles both regular strings and STR_LIST (concatenated strings)
implementation_notes.logging: Outputs debug messages showing what operation would be performed
implementation_notes.current_behavior: Logs the intended operation but does not perform actual HTTP requests, variable loading, or SWF loading
implementation_notes.no_graphics_mode_limitations: Full implementation would require: HTTP client library (libcurl), SWF parser, platform-specific browser integration, and network access - none of which are available in NO_GRAPHICS sandbox environment
implementation_notes.similar_opcodes: Implementation approach similar to GOTO_FRAME (0x81) and GOTO_LABEL (0x8C) which also log operations without performing actual navigation in NO_GRAPHICS mode
